title: Water walking
data:
**Water walking** is a [property](/wiki/Property "Property") in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")* that allows you to walk over deep water without [drowning](/wiki/Drowning "Drowning").

Currently, the only source of water walking in the game is a worn pair of [water walking boots](/wiki/Water_walking_boots "Water walking boots").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Description](#Description)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [3 Variants](#Variants)

  - [3.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [3.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [3.3 FIQHack](#FIQHack)
  - [3.4 EvilHack](#EvilHack)

## Description

Water walking lets you walk over [moats](/wiki/Moat "Moat"), [pools](/wiki/Pool "Pool") and [swamps](/wiki/Swamp "Swamp") as if they were normal land it can also work for walking on [lava](/wiki/Lava "Lava"), you will sustain damage unless you have [fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance") and risk destroying whatever item confers the property if it is flammable - this will plunge you into the lava, with possibly fatal results. Water walking does not work on the [Plane of Water](/wiki/Plane_of_Water "Plane of Water"), as you are situated in air bubbles *within* the water rather than above.

Displacing a [pet](/wiki/Pet "Pet") while standing on water this way will cause them to [drown](/wiki/Drown "Drown") unless they can [swim](/wiki/Swim "Swim") or [fly](/wiki/Fly "Fly"), and standing on water has no effect on [drowning attacks](/wiki/Drowning_attack "Drowning attack").

## Strategy

Players walking over water can #[dip](/wiki/Dip "Dip") as much as they want without fear of releasing monsters as with [fountains](/wiki/Fountain "Fountain"); however, [giant eels](/wiki/Giant_eel "Giant eel") and [kraken](/wiki/Kraken "Kraken") are just as much a danger as before, and [nymphs](/wiki/Nymph "Nymph") and [foocubi](/wiki/Foocubi "Foocubi") can cause you to disrobe and take off your boots, sending you plunging to a possible doom. Take care to avoid [sea monster](/wiki/Sea_monster "Sea monster")-infested waters when dipping, unless you plan to cross quickly or else dispatch potential drowning hazards.

## Variants

Variants often introduce additional sources of water walking; see [the article on water walking boots](/wiki/Water_walking_boots#Variants "Water walking boots") for relevant changes to them in variants.

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), water walking becomes a more vital property to have due to the presence of the [create pool](/wiki/Create_pool "Create pool") [monster spell](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell") on hostile spellcasters in the late game.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [Monks](/wiki/Monk "Monk") gain intrinsic water walking at [experience level](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level") 21. The [Lance of Longinus](/index.php?title=Lance_of_Longinus\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Lance of Longinus (page does not exist)") is an [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") [lance](/wiki/Lance "Lance") that can be [invoked](/wiki/Invoked "Invoked") to toggle the water walking property.

[Binders](/wiki/Binder_\(dNetHack_role\) "Binder (dNetHack role)") that have [Eurynome](/wiki/Spirits_\(dNetHack\)#Eurynome.2C_the_Lonely_Dancer "Spirits (dNetHack)") bound gain water walking, as well as increased speed while on water.

### FIQHack

In [FIQHack](/wiki/FIQHack "FIQHack"), water walking is one of the intrinsic properties a non-cursed [potion of wonder](/wiki/Potion_of_wonder "Potion of wonder") can confer when quaffed; dipping an appropriate item in a non-cursed potion also has a chance of giving it water walking as an [object property](/wiki/Object_property "Object property").

### EvilHack

In EvilHack, monsters are capable of water walking if they put on a pair of water walking boots.

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
html:
Water walking

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

Water walking is a property in NetHack that allows you to walk over deep water without drowning.

Currently, the only source of water walking in the game is a worn pair of water walking boots.

Contents

  • 1 Description
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 Variants
    • 3.1 SLASH'EM
    • 3.2 dNetHack
    • 3.3 FIQHack
    • 3.4 EvilHack

Description

Water walking lets you walk over moats, pools and swamps as if they were normal land it can also work for walking on lava, you will sustain damage unless you have fire resistance and risk destroying whatever item confers the property if it is flammable - this will plunge you into the lava, with possibly fatal results. Water walking does not work on the Plane of Water, as you are situated in air bubbles within the water rather than above.

Displacing a pet while standing on water this way will cause them to drown unless they can swim or fly, and standing on water has no effect on drowning attacks.

Strategy

Players walking over water can #dip as much as they want without fear of releasing monsters as with fountains; however, giant eels and kraken are just as much a danger as before, and nymphs and foocubi can cause you to disrobe and take off your boots, sending you plunging to a possible doom. Take care to avoid sea monster-infested waters when dipping, unless you plan to cross quickly or else dispatch potential drowning hazards.

Variants

Variants often introduce additional sources of water walking; see the article on water walking boots for relevant changes to them in variants.

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, water walking becomes a more vital property to have due to the presence of the create pool monster spell on hostile spellcasters in the late game.

dNetHack

In dNetHack, Monks gain intrinsic water walking at experience level 21. The Lance of Longinus is an artifact lance that can be invoked to toggle the water walking property.

Binders that have Eurynome bound gain water walking, as well as increased speed while on water.

FIQHack

In FIQHack, water walking is one of the intrinsic properties a non-cursed potion of wonder can confer when quaffed; dipping an appropriate item in a non-cursed potion also has a chance of giving it water walking as an object property.

EvilHack

In EvilHack, monsters are capable of water walking if they put on a pair of water walking boots.

Retrieved from "https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Water_walking&oldid=155951"

rawPage:
'''Water walking''' is a [[property]] in ''[[NetHack]]'' that allows you to walk over deep water without [[drowning]].

Currently, the only source of water walking in the game is a worn pair of [[water walking boots]].

==Description==
Water walking lets you walk over [[moat]]s, [[pool]]s and [[swamp]]s as if they were normal land it can also work for walking on [[lava]], you will sustain damage unless you have [[fire resistance]] and risk destroying whatever item confers the property if it is flammable - this will plunge you into the lava, with possibly fatal results. Water walking does not work on the [[Plane of Water]], as you are situated in air bubbles ''within'' the water rather than above.

Displacing a [[pet]] while standing on water this way will cause them to [[drown]] unless they can [[swim]] or [[fly]], and standing on water has no effect on [[drowning attack]]s.

==Strategy==
Players walking over water can #[[dip]] as much as they want without fear of releasing monsters as with [[fountain]]s; however, [[giant eel]]s and [[kraken]] are just as much a danger as before, and [[nymph]]s and [[foocubi]] can cause you to disrobe and take off your boots, sending you plunging to a possible doom. Take care to avoid [[sea monster]]-infested waters when dipping, unless you plan to cross quickly or else dispatch potential drowning hazards.

==Variants==
Variants often introduce additional sources of water walking; see [[Water walking boots#Variants|the article on water walking boots]] for relevant changes to them in variants.

===SLASH'EM===
In [[SLASH'EM]], water walking becomes a more vital property to have due to the presence of the [[create pool]] [[monster spell]] on hostile spellcasters in the late game.

===dNetHack===
In [[dNetHack]], [[Monk]]s gain intrinsic water walking at [[experience level]] 21. The [[Lance of Longinus]] is an [[artifact]] [[lance]] that can be [[invoked]] to toggle the water walking property.

[[Binder (dNetHack role)|Binders]] that have [[Spirits (dNetHack)#Eurynome.2C the Lonely Dancer|Eurynome]] bound gain water walking, as well as increased speed while on water.

===FIQHack===
In [[FIQHack]], water walking is one of the intrinsic properties a non-cursed [[potion of wonder]] can confer when quaffed; dipping an appropriate item in a non-cursed potion also has a chance of giving it water walking as an [[object property]].

===EvilHack===
In EvilHack, monsters are capable of water walking if they put on a pair of water walking boots.
